intro: Bejaria caxamarcensis, commonly known as the Caxamarcensis bejaria, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments at elevations between 1,200 and 2,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
